proposition: Every bounded sequence of real numbers contains a convergent subsequence

condition: the sequence {x_n} is bounded in ℝ

meaning: E is the set of values of the sequence {x_n}

proposition: there exists x∈E and a strictly increasing sequence n_1<n_2<⋯ with x_{n_k}=x for all k
the subsequence {x_{n_k}} is constant and therefore convergent
E has a limit point x

reasons: x is a limit point of E

proposition: given n_k with |x_{n_k}-x|<1/k, there exists n_{k+1}>n_k with |x_{n_{k+1}}-x|<1/(k+1)
reasons: x is a limit point of E

proposition: since lim_{k→∞}1/k=0, the subsequence x_{n_k} converges to x
there exists a convergent subsequence of {x_n}
